com.ibm.jaggr.core.impl

Class ForcedErrorResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.jaggr.core.impl.ForcedErrorResponse

  • public class ForcedErrorResponse
extends Object
    This class encapsulates the forced error response processing for the Aggregator

    • Constructor Detail

      • ForcedErrorResponse

        public ForcedErrorResponse(String info)
                    throws URISyntaxException
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        info - String of the form <status> <count> <skip> <response>

        where <status> is required and is a number specifying the HTTP response code that should be returned for the next request. <count> is optional and specifies the number of times that the specified response status should be returned. If it is not specified, then the response status will be returned only once. skip is optional and specifies the number of requests to process normally before returning the specified response status. <response text> is optional and specifies the text that should be returned in the response body. If it is not specified, then no response text is include.
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException
        NumberFormatException
        IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        public int getStatus()
        Returns the error response status that should be returned for the current response. If the value is zero, then the normal response should be returned and this method should be called again for the next response. If the value is less than 0, then this error response status object is spent and may be discarded.
        Returns:
        the error response status

      • getResponseBody

        public URI getResponseBody()
        Returns:
        the error response URI

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
